p:
The parameter fitting and inference process are rigorously and exhaustively checked within biologically and clinically reasonable ranges. We should have confidence that the fits of observed time-series are realistic because of the consistency with the true underlying epidemiological processes rather than because of artificial model over-fitting. The maximum likelihood estimate (MLE) approach is adopted for model parameter estimation. The 95% confidence intervals (CI) of parameters are estimated based on the parameter ranges in Table 1, using the method of profile likelihood confidence intervals [ 40, 41]. More details for finding the uncertainty of
R 0
( t )
estimation is in S1 Text.
